title: Footballer Andre Gray on the black history icons that make up his tattoo
text:
“In terms of school, we never got taught anything about black history,” he claims. “Growing up, a lot of things are hidden away from you. I only learnt about it a few years ago. Doing that research and going into it deeply, it really opened my eyes. I’m just glad I learnt it.”

Asked if black history should be compulsory in schools, he says “it needs to be channeled the right way,” adding: “You don’t want for [kids] to turn to hate themselves or hate other kids because of what happened [in the past]... At the end of the day, every race needs to understand what went on and is still going on today. It’s not gone away. All kids of all races need to understand, not just about black history but their own history. It’s something that will help you in the future, just in terms of moving on in life, understanding the things your ancestors had to go through.”
description: The Watford FC striker speaks to 1Xtra for Black History Month
